0.12: Do not continue to bring an empty meal-offering; it is an incense of disgust to Me. [Do not continue to] call for gatherings on Shabbos and the new month; I cannot endure iniquity together with gathering.

52.2: He was despised and rejected by men--a man of anguish and knowing sickness. As one hiding his face from us, he was despised and we did not value him.
52.3: Yet surely our sicknesses he was carrying. Our pains he was bearing. And we thought of him as smitten, stricken by God and humiliated.
52.4: And he was pierced for our rebellion; he was crushed for our turning aside. The punishment for our perfection was upon him, and in his wounds there is healing for us.
52.5: Each like a sheep, we wandered off--each to his own path turned. And the Lord upon him visited the sin of us all.
52.6: Oppressed, he was humbled, and he did not open his mouth.
